text: Jill Reynolds (born 1956) is an American contemporary artist known for her work in glass. ==Early life== Reynolds was born in Chicago, Illinois. In 1979 she earned a bachelor's degree in architecture from the Evergreen State College in Olympia, Washington. She received an Master of Fine Arts degree from Rutgers University in 1996. ==Career== In 2003 she was an artist-in- residence at the Pittsburgh Glass Center. Her work is included in the collections of the Seattle Art Museum, the New Britain Museum of American Art, the Corning Museum of Glass and the Tacoma Art Museum. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:20th-century American women artists Category:21st-century American women artists Category:Glass artists Category:Living people
title: Jill Reynolds
